title: 25. The Maiestas Trials
description: An examination of the crime of maiestas under Tiberius, focusing on informers, legal abuse, and Tacitus’ interpretation of treason trials.

questions.question: What did the crime of maiestas originally refer to according to Cicero?
options: An attack on the dignity of the Roman people and their magistrates

questions.question: How does Tacitus define maiestas?
options: Official misconduct damaging the Roman state

questions.question: How did Augustus redefine maiestas?
options: As any offence against the Roman gods
As any insult or offence against the princeps

What proportion of confiscated property did informers receive?
Why did the system encourage abuse?
Who used maiestas charges to enrich himself in 15 CE?
Against whom did Hispo bring charges?
Why was Sabinus targeted?
options: He was a friend of Germanicus

questions.question: How was Sabinus trapped by his accusers?
options: By being tricked into speaking freely

questions.question: What effect did such practices have on Roman society?
options: An atmosphere of secrecy and fear

questions.question: What was Falanius accused of?
options: Allowing a comic actor to join the worship of Augustus

questions.question: Why was Libo Drusus charged with maiestas?
How were some maiestas charges linked to other crimes?

How did Sejanus’ influence affect the use of maiestas trials?

questions.question: What happened to prosecutions after Sejanus’ death?

questions.question: How does Tacitus exaggerate the impact of the maiestas trials?
